Detailed Description

Offers an (E)rror measure for (C)lassification tasks, that can be used for monitoring, but not for training.

Member Function Documentation

double CE::ce ( const Array< double > &  in,
const Array< double > &  out,
double  min = 0,
double  max = 1. 
) [inline]

A classification error measure, similar to the "winner takes it all" scheme (ErrorMeasures::wta).

As "the winner takes it all" error measure (ErrorMeasures::wta) the output vectors model(in) are transformed into bitvectors and compared to the target-bitvector out. In contrast to "wta", not the output neuron with the best value is set to "1" and all other output neurons to zero, but all output neurons with a value greater than (max + min) / 2 are set to max and all other output neurons are set to min.

Parameters:
in Input vector for the model.
out The target vector, that must be a bitvector.
min Minimum value
max Maximum value
Returns:
The classification error.
Author:
C. Igel
Date:
1999
Changes
none
Status
stable
